name: The 38 Dex Harper (Rogue 23 / Fighter 12 / Harper Scout 5)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The 38 Dex Harper 

"Strangely enough"? Are you kidding me? You think it's strange that people haven't posted builds using HS? It's the red-headed stepchild of prestige classes!!

- Kaliban99, to Kail Pendragon, in The Field Scout Sunday, 06 November 2005



Introduction:
Greetings all!
This is my attempt at the most useful Harper Scout I could conceive.

The features are:
- Rogue for 12d6 sneak attack, evasion/improved evasion, uncanny dodge, crippling strike, epic dodge, great skills
- Fighter to help with combat feats pre-epic and epic, weapon specialization/epic weapon specialization for non-sneak damage
- Harper Scout to help with discipline skill dumps and two bonus feats into great dexterity

Probably the only redeeming feature of Harper Scout in this build is the Great Dexterity feats, which one pays for with needing to take Iron Will / Alertness. Funnily enough, Iron Will and Alertness are useful in this build. 
With the extra dexterity, I try to accentuate this particular 'strength' by putting the dex score as high as possible. Dexterity rogues will not quite get a dex score that high without bonus great dexterity feats from Assassin (ie Assassin 18 can provide two bonus great dexterity feats), but then you have to be evil.

Basic stats at a glance:
Base AB 45, 43 with ITWF shortswords, Blind Fight/Improved Knockdown, Weapon Specialization/Epic Weapon Specialization, 12d6 sneak attack
Base 368hp (508 capped), F21W17R34 +2 saves against spells
338 skill points, max discipline, stealth, near max spot, DT 38 modified, Tumble 40, UMD 33 modified, open lock 24 modified etc
Harper coolness, namely the Dex score of a well built assassin sneaker without having to be evil
Base Dex 38 cap-able at 50 (hooray!)

I chose elf, 20% exp penalties from lvl 18-40. 
Halfling gets no exp penalties and has +1 AB and +1AC and +40 hp at the cost of some strength and keen senses and a worse ability to knockdown opponents. 
Both races seem good here but overall elf seemed the most fun. 
Dwarf and Human would have been good too, but then you don't get the 38 Dex and it didn't seem as fun.


Anyway hope you enjoy. Delighted to hear comments, may take this one for a run some day soon

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
That looks pretty good to me, but I would take the same pre-epic feats in a different order:
Spoiler01: Rogue(1): Blind Fight 03: Fighter(2): Two-Weapon Fighting, Weapon Focus: Shortsword 05: Rogue(3): {Uncanny Dodge I} 07: Fighter(4): Weapon Specialization: Shortsword 09: Rogue(5): Knockdown 11: Fighter(6): Improved Two-Weapon Fighting 13: Rogue(7) 15: Fighter(8): Iron Will, Toughness 17: Rogue(9) 19: Rogue(11) 21: Fighter(9): Epic Weapon Focus: Shortsword 23: Rogue(13): Defensive Roll
At the very beginning, your AB isn't good enough to handle the AB penalty for dual-wielding.  Starting like this would be even better, except for fewer skill points, and NPC's would call you a Fighter, rather than a Rogue, but your AB at level 1 would be 7 points better (+1 from BAB, +1 from Weapon Focus, and +5 from Weapon Finesse):
Spoiler 01: Fighter(1): Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus: Shortsword 03: Fighter(2): Two-Weapon Fighting, Ambidexterity 05: Rogue(3): {Uncanny Dodge I}

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Slight problem with your first variant, Empyre. Toughness, Iron Will and Alertness all need to be taken as general feats, so one of the feats you want at level 15 will have to come earlier, swapping with IKD at 12, perhaps?

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Empyre65 and Stag
These are good tweaks, very sharp eyes on both of you
To be honest the only reason I didn't put weapon focus at level one was some environments have re-leveling wands
If you didn't like the weapon you chose then you can relevel your character provided all the choices you made at level 1 you are happy with (also other features like feats etc)
In environments without these, then weapon focus at level 1 would be what I would recommend
Fighter at level 1 is a nice variant too in certain environments, reduces reliance on the ranged weapon at level 1, tumble 5 at level 2 for +1 AC etc... just the 6x4 skill points one loses is the downside, there is space for more skill points crossclassed into spellcraft for sure
One could min-max a bit less and take Epic Fort and Epic Will epic levels for better saves if you feel UMD (ie Death Ward/Shadow Shield, Prot v Evil/Clarity/Lesser Mind Blank/Mind Blank, Prot v Spells) won't do the job or its nerfed
